Job Posting: 176585 - Position: S26 Lab Tech Co-op/Intern (28078) 176585 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/16/2026 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/06/2026 03:47 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Nokia Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Lab Tech Co-op/Intern (28078) 176585 Co-op Position Ottawa, ON Canada 4 months In-Person CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $41,184 to $91,184 per year Your responsibilities As a part of our team, you will: • Locate hardware boards, test setups, cables, and related equipment for HW, SW, Test, and Customer teams. • Support lab moves, additions, and modifications to keep environments organized and operational. • Set up PCs and workstations and assist with equipment relocation within the lab. • Maintain, repair, and configure third-party test and measurement instruments. • Manage equipment calibration processes to ensure accuracy and compliance. • Investigate network issues and replace defective or malfunctioning networking equipment. • Maintain a clean, safe, and organized lab environment for all users. Coordinate the return shipment of rental test equipment that is no longer required. • Job Requirements Your skills and experience • Currently a candidate for a Bachelor's degree or Diploma in Computer Systems, Computer Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field at an accredited school in Canada. • Strong computer skills with the ability to learn new tools and systems quickly. • Effective interpersonal and communication skills for collaborative work environments. • General knowledge of telecommunications products, technologies, or network concepts. More information Some of our benefits for students in Canada: • Flexible and hybrid working schemes to balance work and life • Professional development events and networking opportunities • Campus perks designed to make your student experience enjoyable and social, such as access to an onsite cafeteria, free employee parking, complimentary fitness centre, and sports facilities (volleyball, basketball, pickleball courts, ping pong, and employee leagues) • Well-being programs, including Personal Support Service 24/7 - a confidential support channel open to all Nokia employees and their families in challenging situations • Opportunities to join Nokia Employee Resource Groups (NERGs) and connect with people who share your passions and values • Employee Growth Solutions, mentorship programs, and coaching support for your career development A learning environment that fosters both personal growth and professional development - for your role and beyond • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://jobs.nokia.com/en/sites/CX_1/job/28078/?keyword=28078&mode=location Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
